senses.sense_definition: The collective body of Jewish religious law, including biblical law, rabbinic law, and customs.

examples.text: The rabbi has dedicated his life to the study of <w>Halacha</w>.
According to <w>Halacha</w>, work is strictly forbidden on the Sabbath.

senses.sense_definition: A specific law, rule, or tradition derived from the Torah and rabbinic literature.

examples.text: The student asked for clarification on a specific <w>halacha</w> regarding dietary restrictions.
Observing every <w>halacha</w> requires significant knowledge and dedication.
